Description: Fragment of rim and wall of East Greek pottery plate. On underside, broad black band at rim, series of bands towards centre; bars on edge of rim, left-facing stopt maeander band between lines on top of rim; on outside of floor, between bands with added red and white lines, triglyph-metope frieze of vertical bars and rosettes; trace of frieze nearer centre.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1153)
